contentrichtext.text: '''Robert G. Wilmers''' (born 1935) is an [[United States|American]] businessman.<ref name="businessweek">[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=272287&ticker=MTB Bloomberg BusinessWeek]</ref><ref name="forbes">[http://www.forbes.com/profile/robert-wilmers/ Forbes]</ref> He serves as the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of [[M&T Bank]].<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="forbes"/><ref name="nocera">Joe Nocera, [http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/31/opinion/31nocera.html?_r=0 The Good Banker], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 30, 2011 </ref> ==Biography== ===Early life=== He graduated from the [[Phillips Exeter Academy]], [[Harvard College]] and received an M.B.A. from the [[Harvard Business School]] in 1959.<ref name="businessweek"/> ===Career=== He started his career at [[Bankers Trust]].<ref name="businessweek"/> He served on the Board of Directors of the [[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]] from 1993 to 1998.<ref name="businessweek"/> He also served on the Board of [[Allied Irish Banks]].<ref name="businessweek"/> In 1998, he became the owner of the [[ChÃ¢teau Haut-Bailly]] vineyard in [[France]].<ref name="businessweek"/> He has served as Chairman and CEO of M&T Bank since 2006.<ref name="businessweek"/><ref name="forbes"/> He sits on the Boards of Directors of the Buffalo Niagara Partnership, the Business Council of New York State and has served the City of [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]] (NY) on its state-appointed control board.<ref name="businessweek"/> He is a member of the [[Council on Foreign Relations]].<ref name="businessweek"/> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wilmers, Robert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American businessman | DATE OF BIRTH = 1935 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wilmers, Robert}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Buffalo, New York]] [[Category:Harvard Business School alumni]] {{US-business-bio-1930s-stub}}
